metadata.Title: CVE-2014-6053 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The rfbProcessClientNormalMessage function in libvncserver/rfbserver.c in LibVNCServer 0.9.9 and earlier does not properly handle attempts to send a large amount of ClientCutText data, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption or daemon crash) via a crafted message that is processed by using a single unchecked malloc.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-6053` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

krfb - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

libvncserver-config - 0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libvncserver0 - 0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
linuxvnc - 0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

tightvncserver - 1.3.9-6.5+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1
xtightvncviewer - 1.3.9-6.5+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: italc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
krfb package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.13.3-0ubuntu1.1').
libvncserver package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1').
tightvnc package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.9-6.5+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1').
vino: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
